MDLA is a new kind of fashion magazine - a fashion magazine designed for how we consume fashion online today.

Many of us born in an online generation can only sigh in nostalgia at the glamour and wonder of print fashion magazines from the early 2000s. As the world moved online, the once iconic fashion media companies failed to evolve - they gave us lazy pdfs to browse on slow and buggy e-readers as Inst*gr*m took over to give us the fast immersive content we wanted. Their disinterest in the preservation of beauty online is clear and it’s time we had a new medium to explore and appreciate fashion for fashion’s sake. MDLA is an experiment to revive the glory of early fashion media re-imagined through powerful online media technology from present day.

Our first iteration MDLA Runway brings you a variety of powerful features you’d expect from a modern fashion runway viewer:

* Intuitive Interface - Flip through runway looks with a simple swipe or drag. Jump through to your favorite designer’s early years with just a tap and slide. No endless scroll, no ads, no interruptions

AFRA is an African contemporary art mobile app for discovering and learning about the world's most exciting, innovative and influential contemporary artists.
You will find in this app both established artists, as well as emerging artists who are not yet well known. 

Each day, our editorial team will introduce you to African contemporary art through a short article written by an expert in the field. Our articles will give you all necessary information about the artist, their work, creative process and the stories behind their creations as well as a look at his/her biography and influences.

Afra has been created to give visibility to one of the most important cultural movements of our time, which is represented by artists who are now part of the international artistic circuit but who have for too long remained unknown. We believe that this movement must be known by everyone.

AFRA is committed to promoting an open dialogue about art by fostering a global community of artists, curators, collectors and enthusiasts in order to celebrate our diverse culture through the visual arts.

Our goal is to connect with a global audience who will be inspired by the quality of work presented on AFRA and motivated to learn more about African contemporary art. 

We believe that great art is something that should be accessible to everyone, no matter where they are in the world or what their background is. The app has been designed for all people who love contemporary art and want to know more about it.

By providing this app, we hope to bridge the gap between those who create art and those who simply want to enjoy it.

Our team works hard every day to bring you only the best content from across the globe.
